elements.title: Nesselrode pudding
elements.contents: ... that novelist Susie Boyt described Nesselrode pudding (example pictured) as tasting "of Christmas, without any of the disappointment"?

elements.title: seized by the United States off the coast of Venezuela
elements.contents: ... that, according to Guyanese authorities, an oil tanker seized by the United States off the coast of Venezuela in 2025 was falsely flying Guyana's flag?

elements.title: G.O.A.T. India Tour
elements.contents: ... that a 70-foot (21 m) statue of Lionel Messi was unveiled in India during his G.O.A.T. India Tour?

elements.title: Right Here, Right Now
elements.contents: ... that "Right Here, Right Now" was Giorgio Moroder's first song in 15 years to reach the top of the US Dance Club Songs chart?

elements.title: Marc L. Greenberg
elements.contents: ... that future Slavic-language professor Marc L. Greenberg learned Slovene after his fiancée sent him a bilingual dictionary and started writing letters to him only in Slovene?

elements.title: Alhaitham
elements.contents: ... that the Genshin Impact character Alhaitham is believed to be named after a polymath from the Islamic Golden Age?

elements.title: Diego García Miravete
elements.contents: ... that Diego García Miravete and his college football team's games were closely monitored by the Mexican government in the early 1970s?

elements.title: Mama's Gun
elements.contents: ... that Erykah Badu recorded Mama's Gun at what was once Jimi Hendrix's apartment?

elements.title: A Short Hike
elements.contents: ... that some reviewers thought that A Short Hike was too short?
